alert.note: Alert for Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:40PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Okanogan County through 915 PM PDT... At 840 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 33 miles west of Tonasket, or 37 miles northwest of Omak, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chewuch Campground, Camp Four Campground, Andrews Creek Campground, Ruffed Grouse Campground, Honeymoon Campground and Nice Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
